headline: Emerson price target raised to $135 from $128 at Wells Fargo
summary: Wells Fargo analyst Joseph O’Dea raised the firm’s price target on Emerson (EMR) to $135 from $128 and keeps an Overweight rating on the shares. Portfolio news today marks a critical step toward finalizing a multi-year effort in transforming Emerson to pure-play automation, which the firm thinks can drive a re-rating. Wells adds that operational execution in Q4 remained solid and the outlook for 2025 is encouraging. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving bre

headline: Emerson Electric : Industrial Automation Vision to Meet Future Demands for Safety, Sustainability and Profitability
summary: Emerson today released its Innovations in Automation magazine focused on the company's Boundless Automation™ architectural vision. The 20th issue, available in eight languages, spotlights how recent...
